section.section: A guaranty made by the Authority may not exceed the term of the contract, unless the Authority determines that a longer term better serves the purposes of this subtitle.

The Authority may use the Fund to guarantee a person's proposed equity investment in the applicant only if:
the applicant meets the requirements of this part;
the amount of the equity investment to be guaranteed does not exceed the lesser of:
the equity investment to be guaranteed is to be used to perform a contract for which the majority of funding is provided by the federal government, a state government, a local government, or a utility regulated by the Public Service Commission; and
the equity investment to be guaranteed is to be used for:

The Authority may not guarantee the equity investment of a person who:
previously held an equity investment in the applicant;
previously participated in the management of the applicant; or
in any other manner is related to:
A loan that the Authority makes shall mature not later than the term of the contract, unless the Authority finds that a longer term better serves the purposes of this part.

text.section: In providing financial assistance under this section, the Authority shall recognize the need to serve applicants from all political subdivisions in the State.
